summary.span: Represents time in divisions, such as weeks, months, and years.

span.span: Represents time in divisions, such as weeks, months, and years.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 日历将时间划分为单元，如周、 月和年。A calendar divides time into units, such as weeks, months, and years. 参数数目、 长度和部门开始在每个日历有变化。The number, length, and start of the divisions vary in each calendar. > [!NOTE] > 有关在.NET Framework 中使用的日历类的信息，请参阅[使用日历](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md)。For information about using the calendar classes in the .NET Framework, see [Working with Calendars](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md). 任何时刻可以表示为一组使用特定日历的数字值。Any moment in time can be represented as a set of numeric values using a particular calendar. 例如，春分发生 (1999 年，3、 20、 8、 46、 0、 0.0) 在公历日历中，即 20，1999 年 3 月公元For example, a vernal equinox occurred at (1999, 3, 20, 8, 46, 0, 0.0) in the Gregorian calendar, that is, March 20, 1999 C.E. 在 8:46:00:0.0。at 8:46:00:0.0. 实现可以映射到一组类似的数字值的特定日历的范围中的任何日期和可以将此类设置的数字值映射到使用中的信息的文本化表示和。An implementation of can map any date in the range of a specific calendar to a similar set of numeric values, and can map such sets of numeric values to a textual representation using information from and . 文本表示形式可以是区分区域性的例如，"上午 8:46 年 3 月 20 1999 AD"对于 EN-US 区域性，或不区分区域性的例如，"1999年-03-20T08:46:00"采用 ISO 8601 格式。The textual representation can be culture-sensitive, for example, "8:46 AM March 20th 1999 AD" for the en-US culture, or culture-insensitive, for example, "1999-03-20T08:46:00" in ISO 8601 format. A实现可以定义一个或多个纪元。A implementation can define one or more eras. 类标识的纪元为枚举的整数，其中当前纪元 () 具有值 0。The class identifies the eras as enumerated integers, where the current era () has the value 0. 若要弥补日历年和地球围绕太阳旋转的实际时间或地球围绕一个月亮旋转的实际时间之间的差异，闰年具有从标准日历年不同数量的天数。To make up for the difference between the calendar year and the actual time that the earth rotates around the sun or the actual time that the moon rotates around the earth, a leap year has a different number of days from a standard calendar year. 每个实现以不同方式定义闰年。Each implementation defines leap years differently. 为了保持一致性，每个间隔 （的第一个月，例如） 中的第一个单位分配的值 1。For consistency, the first unit in each interval (the first month, for example) is assigned the value 1. 命名空间包括以下实现：The namespace includes the following implementations: - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示的成员类。The following code example demonstrates the members of the class. span.para: 在 [！INCLUDE[net_portable](~/includes/net-portable-md.md)]，类构造函数不可用，并且类派生自不是公共。如果所需的一个特定的类型，例如一个公历日历必须检索从或属性，或从属性数组。

In the [!INCLUDE[net_portable](~/includes/net-portable-md.md)], the class constructor is unavailable, and classes derived from are not public. If you want a calendar of a specific type, such as a Gregorian calendar object, you have to retrieve it from the or property, or from the property array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在日历中支持闰月的概念，在某个特定的月份之后或在每一年中的任何月份之后发生的闰月。In a calendar that supports the notion of a leap month, the leap month can occur either after a particular month or after any month in a year. 例如，方法返回一个数字，介于 1 和 13，该值指示指定的日期与关联的月份。For example, the method returns a number between 1 and 13 that indicates the month associated with a specified date. 如果一年中，在第八个和第 9 个月之间存在闰月方法闰第八个月的 9 和 10 第 9 个月的第八个月份返回 8。If there is a leap month between the eighth and ninth months of the year, the method returns 8 for the eighth month, 9 for the leap eighth month, and 10 for the ninth month.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要弥补日历年和地球围绕太阳旋转的实际时间或地球围绕一个月亮旋转的实际时间之间的差异，闰年具有从标准日历年不同数量的天数。To make up for the difference between the calendar year and the actual time that the earth rotates around the sun or the actual time that the moon rotates around the earth, a leap year has a different number of days from a standard calendar year. 每个实现以不同方式定义闰年。Each implementation defines leap years differently. 闰日是仅在闰年中发生了一天。A leap day is a day that occurs only in a leap year. 例如，在公历日历的年 2 月 29 日是唯一的闰日。For example, in the Gregorian calendar, the 29th day of February is the only leap day. ## Examples 下面的代码示例比较的不同实施类。The following code example compares different implementations of the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要弥补日历年和地球围绕太阳旋转的实际时间或地球围绕一个月亮旋转的实际时间之间的差异，闰年具有从标准日历年不同数量的天数。To make up for the difference between the calendar year and the actual time that the earth rotates around the sun or the actual time that the moon rotates around the earth, a leap year has a different number of days from a standard calendar year. 每个实现以不同方式定义闰年。Each implementation defines leap years differently. 闰月是仅在闰年中发生的整月。A leap month is an entire month that occurs only in a leap year. 例如，在希伯来历中，闰阿达尔月是唯一的闰月。For example, in the Hebrew calendar, Adar Beit is the only leap month. ## Examples 下面的代码示例比较的不同实施类。The following code example compares different implementations of the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 是可以用两位数年份表示的 100 年范围内的最后一年。 is the last year in the 100-year range that can be represented by a two-digit year. 通过查找两位数字的唯一匹配项来确定世纪`year`该 100 年范围内。The century is determined by finding the sole occurrence of the two-digit `year` within that 100-year range. 例如，如果设置为 2029，则 100 年范围是从 1930年为 2029年。For example, if is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，为 30 的 2 位值被解释为 1930，而 29 一个 2 位数字值被解释为 2029年。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 如果`year`大于或等于 100 的值`year`不经更改即返回。If `year` is greater than or equal to 100, the value of `year` is returned unchanged. 支持两位数年份或四位数年份。 supports either a two-digit year or a four-digit year. 将两位数年份值 (小于 100) 传递会导致方法的值转换为一个四位数字值根据值，该值表示相应的纪元。Passing a two-digit year value (less than 100) causes the method to convert the value to a four-digit value according to the value representing the appropriate century. 如果应用程序提供在支持的日历范围到内的四位数年份值，该方法返回实际的输入的值。If the application supplies a four-digit year value that is within the supported calendar range to , the method returns the actual input value. 如果应用程序提供一个四位数字值超出了支持的日历，或者它提供了负值，则该方法将引发异常。If the application supplies a four-digit value that is outside the supported calendar range, or if it supplies a negative value, the method throws an exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性允许两位数年份，要正确转换为 4 位数年份。This property allows a 2-digit year to be properly translated to a 4-digit year. 例如，如果此属性设置为 2029年，100 年范围是从 1930年为 2029年。For example, if this property is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，为 30 的 2 位值被解释为 1930，而 29 一个 2 位数字值被解释为 2029年。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 此属性的初始值被派生自控制面板的区域和语言选项部分中的设置。The initial value of this property is derived from the settings in the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 但是，该信息可以更改的生命周期内。However, that information can change during the life of the . 类不会检测系统设置中的更改自动。The class does not detect changes in the system settings automatically. 如果在区域和语言选项不支持这种日历，此属性的初始值是通过定义的默认值类。If the calendar is not supported in the regional and language options, the initial value of this property is the default value defined by the class. 你的应用程序应将此值设置为 99，以指示按字面解释 2 位数字的年份。Your application should set this value to 99 to indicate that 2-digit years are to be taken literally. 例如，如果此属性设置为 99，100 年范围为 0 （不是有效值对于大多数日历而言） 和 99 之间。For example, if this property is set to 99, the 100-year range is from 0 (not a valid value for most calendars) to 99. 因此，为 30 的 2 位值被解释为 30。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 30.
